page.title: 07Farming(2) in Leverton
page.content: Years ago many animals were kept for food and work.Nowadays only one farmer keeps cattle,sheep and horses.The cattle are bred for meat as are the sheep but the horses are Shires primarily for showing.The cattle are mixed breeds mainly continental Charolais and Limousin crossed with Hereford, Friesian and Lincoln Red in order to produce good quality meat in quantity.The cattle are shedded in crewyards during the winter and on rented grassland or the outmarsh during the summer.They are fed on silage and concentrates during the winter but fend for themselves during the rest of the year.The manure from the winter shedding is eventually ploughed back into the land to increase the humus content and lessen the need for commercially manufactured fertilizer.
